info.jonclark.treegraft.chartparser
Class Key<R extends GrammarRule<T>,T extends Token>

java.lang.Object
  info.jonclark.treegraft.chartparser.Key<R,T>
Type Parameters:
R - The rule type being used in this ChartParser
T - The token type being used in this ChartParser
public class Key<R extends GrammarRule<T>,T extends Token>
extends java.lang.Object

Stores information about an item that has already been proven to be a complete parse. This class will be hashed by the Chart millions of times, so an efficient hashCode() and equals(Object) method is essential. This class is also one place where ambiguity UN-packing occurs when final parses are being formatted via the getPartialParses method.

Author:
Jonathan Clark

Constructor Detail

Key

public Key(ActiveArc<R,T> arc,
           T word)
Create a Key for a non-terminal or terminal grammar rule. This constructor is responsible for creating each key's score (log probability) based on the backpointers of its consituent keys.

Parameters:
arc - The completed ActiveArc that called for the creation of this Key
word - The terminal token associated with this key; null if this is a non-terminal Key

public Parse<R,T>[] getPartialParses(ParseFormatter<R,T> formatter)
Gets the partial (or possibly complete) parses associated with this Key as formatted by the ParseFormatter.

Parameters:
formatter - an object that determines how the resulting parses will look (including whether they are source trees, target trees, or target strings).
